name: mint tea socks
notes:
**a gift from me to you my lovely knitting friends.**

if you have enjoyed this pattern and would like to support me providing future free patterns, you can buy me a coffee/tea [here][1]

*pull up a chair, take a seat, and slip into the conversation. sip your tea, and pick up your needles so we can cast-on together, clatter and chatter in sync. let’s get comfy in cozy company.*


inspired by my favourite tea, and thoughts of knitting with friends. these socks are worked top down, the pattern includes instructions for a heel flap and gusset, a modified wedge toe and how to work these in a contrast yarn (optional).

the stitch pattern is worked on the front of the sock and is written and charted. i have used a little lace leaf motif which fades into my fav knitted texture, seed stitch or as we are all familiar with the hermione everyday sock stitch pattern, a fantastic sock pattern and one of my favourites, thanks to erica for your support.❤

**sizes**
small, (medium, large) finished sock circumference, unstretched 18 ( 20.25, 23) cm / 7 (8, 9) inches.

**skill level**
a basic understand of sock construction, knitting in the round, simple knit and purl stitches, increases, decreases and how to kitchener stitch.

  [1]: https://ko-fi.com/daisystitches
  [2]: https://www.instagram.com/daisystitches/?hl=en
